title: Multiple Share Ownership Changes Reported on the Indonesia Stock Exchange
body: Teguh Patriawan increased his stake in PT Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera Tbk (unlisted) to 10.48% by purchasing 46.89 million shares, while PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, the controller of PT Petrosea Tbk (PTRO), acquired 17.46 million shares, raising its stake to 41.69%. Meanwhile, Cathay Utima Investment Pte Ltd sold 30.79 million shares of PT Suparma Tbk (unlisted), and Prajogo Pangestu sold 3 million shares of PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (unlisted), reducing his stake to 5.05%.

title: PLN Prepares 1,000 Public Electric Vehicle Charging Stations for Eid al-Fitr Travelers
body: PT PLN (PLN) has prepared 1,000 public electric vehicle charging stations at 615 strategic locations along the Trans-Java-Sumatra route to ensure a smooth journey for electric vehicle users during the Idul Fitri 1446 Hijriah holiday period. This move is in response to the increasing number of electric vehicle users, with PLN focusing on providing charging infrastructure during Ramadan and Idul Fitri.

title: Pertamina Offers Free Oil Change for Flood-Affected Vehicles in Jabodetabek Area
body: Pertamina (PERTM) through its subsidiaries, Pertamina Patra Niaga and Pertamina Lubricants, provided free oil change services to flood-affected vehicles in the Jabodetabek area on March 5, 2025, at three locations, benefiting the local community. The program received a positive response from the community, supporting the recovery of flood-damaged vehicles and promoting the use of Pertamina Enduro oil.

title: Wit Oemar Appointed Head of Corporate Banking at Citi Indonesia
body: Wit Oemar has been appointed as the Head of Corporate Banking at Citibank, N.A., Indonesia (C), reporting to K. Balasubramanian and Batara Sianturi, and will lead initiatives to strengthen client relationships across local corporates, financial institutions, and multinational clients. Oemar, a founding member of Citi Commercial Bank Indonesia, has held various leadership roles within the company, including Director of Local Corporates and Head of Global Subsidiaries Group, Indonesia.

title: Indonesian Government Officially Hands Over 221,000 Hectares of Seized Palm Oil Land to State-Owned Enterprise for Biodiesel Program.
body: The Indonesian Attorney General's Office has officially handed over 221,000 hectares of palm oil land, seized from the corruption case of PT Duta Palma, to the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises, which will be utilized for the biodiesel program. The land will be managed by PT Agrinas Palma Nusantara, a state-owned company in the palm oil sector, marking a significant development in the country's biodiesel initiative.

title: Indonesia Revives Coal Gasification Project Despite High Technology and Investment Risks
body: The Indonesian government, led by President Prabowo Subianto, is reviving plans for 21 hilirisasi projects, including four gasification projects that aim to convert coal into dimethyl ether (DME), despite concerns over high technology requirements and large investments. The projects are part of the government's efforts to promote domestic energy self-sufficiency and reduce reliance on imported fuels.

title: Indonesian General Insurance Industry's Equity Decreases to IDR 74.6 Trillion in 2024.
body: Indonesia's general insurance industry saw its equity decline to Rp 74.6 trillion in December 2024, down from Rp 88.5 trillion at the end of 2023, according to data from the Financial Services Authority. This decline is a setback for the industry, which is struggling to meet the minimum equity requirements.

title: Indonesian Government to Increase Royalty Tariffs for Mineral and Coal Commodities
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources is set to increase royalty tariffs on mineral and coal commodities, revising Government Regulation No. 26/2022 on non-tax state revenue. The move aims to improve the management of non-tax state revenue, which may require mining and coal businesses to dig deeper into their pockets.

title: Indonesia's International Investment Position Records Net Liability of $245.3 Billion at End of Q4 2024
body: At the end of Q4-2024, Indonesia's international investment position recorded a net liability of $245.3 billion, down from $270.4 billion in Q3-2024, due to an increase in foreign financial assets and a decrease in foreign financial liabilities. The country's foreign financial assets stood at $522.8 billion in Q4-2024, up 0.6% from the previous quarter.

title: Indonesian Reinsurance Industry Faces Challenges in 2024 with Decreasing Premium Income.
body: Indonesia's reinsurance industry is expected to face a tough year in 2024, with revenue declining 4.4% to IDR 25.9 trillion in 2023, according to the Financial Services Authority. The industry is still facing challenges in 2025, which will likely continue to impact its performance in the early part of the year.

title: Regional Tax Revenue in Indonesia Reaches IDR 12.63 Trillion in January 2025, Down 32.46% from Last Year.
body: The Directorate General of Fiscal Balance at the Ministry of Finance reported that regional tax revenue realization until January 2025 reached IDR 12.63 trillion, equivalent to 4.34% of the 2025 target of IDR 281.26 trillion, and down 32.46% from January 2024's IDR 18.7 trillion. The low realization was due to only 342 out of 546 local governments submitting their regional tax revenue reports.

title: Government Launches Village Cooperative Program to Eradicate Poverty and Reduce Inequality
body: The Indonesian government has committed to reducing poverty and inequality through the establishment of the Red and White Village Cooperative (Kopdes), which aims to empower rural communities and promote economic growth, with an initial investment of IDR 350 trillion (approximately USD 23.3 billion) to be disbursed across 70,000 villages. The Kopdes program is expected to increase economic growth, reduce poverty, and improve food security, with targets including a poverty rate of 4.5%-5% and an economic growth rate of 8% by 2029.

title: Rupiah Weakens 0.44% Against US Dollar Amid Ongoing Trade War Sentiment.
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened 0.44% against the US dollar to close at Rp 16,367 on Monday, driven by several factors, including the ongoing trade war sentiment between the US and China. The sentiment intensified following China's retaliatory tariffs, which took effect yesterday, according to Josua Pardede, Head of Economics at Bank Permata.

title: Digital gold investment gains popularity in Indonesia with transaction value reaching Rp 5 trillion in first two months of 2025.
body: In the first two months of 2025, the nominal value of physical gold digital transactions on the Indonesia Commodity Derivative Exchange (ICDX) reached Rp 5 trillion, a 34% year-over-year increase from Rp 3.7 trillion. This growth is driven by the increasing demand for digital gold investments in Indonesia, fueled by the convenience and practicality of digitalization.

title: Astra International's Performance Expected to Grow Despite Facing Challenges This Year
body: PT Astra International Tbk (ASII) is expected to maintain growth despite slowing down this year due to challenges such as declining consumer purchasing power and high interest rates affecting vehicle sales. Additionally, weak coal commodity prices will also impact ASII's performance, according to Edvisor Profina Visindo's investment analyst, Ahmad Iqbal Suyudi.

title: Weakening Rupiah Slows Down Offshore Loan Usage by Indonesian Financing Companies
body: The strengthening of the US dollar has impacted the funding strategies of Indonesian financing companies, with the use of offshore loans slowing down in recent years due to the rupiah's depreciation. According to Bank Indonesia data, the value of foreign debt obligations of leasing companies has continued to decline, from IDR 105 trillion in 2018 to IDR 56 trillion last year.

title: Prabowo's Cabinet Launches Four Programs to Improve Welfare, But Lacks Detailed Planning
body: The Indonesian government's "Red and White Cabinet" has launched four programs, including the "Red and White Cooperative" which aims to improve rural welfare and economy, with a target of 70,000 units and initial funding of IDR 3-5 billion per unit. The programs, including "Free Nutritious Food" and "Three Million Houses", aim to increase people's welfare, but lack detailed plans and funding mechanisms, raising concerns about their feasibility and effectiveness.

title: PT Bumi Resources Minerals appoints PT Macmahon Indonesia as underground mining contractor for Poboya gold mine in Palu, Sulawesi.
body: PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk (BRMS) has appointed PT Macmahon Indonesia as the underground mining contractor for its Poboya gold mine in Palu, Sulawesi, to develop the mine and extract mineral ore. The contract scope includes drilling, transportation, and loading of ore, as well as maintenance of mining equipment and provision of mining services.

title: Jakarta Stock Index Corrects After Three-Day Rally Amid Foreign Investor Sell-Off
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) corrected at the start of the week, rising 0.56% to 6,598.21, despite foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 843.43 billion. The government's policy, including the placement of state-owned bank funds in the Red-White Cooperative, gave negative sentiment to state-owned bank issuers, which are among the IHSG's main supports.

title: Global Oil Price Drop Expected to Impact Indonesia's Import Performance
body: Global crude oil prices are expected to decline, which will likely suppress Indonesia's oil import value, despite overall imports potentially increasing. As of Monday, WTI crude oil prices for April 2025 delivery fell 5.24% to $67.15 per barrel, while Brent crude oil prices dropped 4.63% to $70.46 per barrel since the end of 2024.

title: Indonesian Tax Authority Reviews and Refines Tax Structure and Withholding Scheme for Article 21 Income Tax.
body: The Indonesian Directorate General of Taxes has been using an average effective tariff scheme to calculate income tax (Article 21) since January 1, 2024, but is now reviewing the tariff structure and withholding tax scheme to simplify reporting and withholding processes. The goal is to achieve simplicity in income tax withholding and reporting, with the review process still ongoing, according to Director of Education, Service, and Public Relations at the Directorate General of Taxes, Dwi Astuti.

title: PT Dian Swastatika Sentosa to Develop Data Center in Jakarta with $300 Million Investment
body: PT Dian Swastatika Sentosa Tbk (DSSA) is strengthening its digital infrastructure business through its unit SM+, which is developing a data center, SMX01, in Jakarta's central business district, with an investment of over $300 million. The project is a result of a collaboration between SM+ and Korea Investment Real Asset Management, marking a significant milestone in the company's digital infrastructure expansion.

title: Indonesian Ministry Reports Handling of Over 1.3 Million Pornography and Online Gambling Content Cases.
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Communication and Digital reported handling 1,352,401 cases of online pornography and gambling content from October 20, 2024, to March 8, 2025, with 233,552 pornography cases and 1,118,849 gambling cases. The majority of these cases came from websites and platforms, with Meta (META) being a significant contributor to the latter, with 46,207 cases.

title: Pertamina Patra Niaga faces new investigation over alleged monopoly on non-subsidized LPG sales.
body: PT Pertamina Patra Niaga (PERTamina) faces another issue as the Indonesian Commission for Supervision of Business Competition (KPPU) investigates alleged monopolistic practices in the sale of non-subsidized liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) in the midstream market. This comes after the company was previously involved in a case of alleged fuel blending, adding to its growing list of problems.

title: Government and Online Transportation Companies Agree on Holiday Allowance Rules for Online Drivers
body: The Indonesian government has agreed with online transportation companies to provide holiday allowances to online drivers, following a meeting between President Prabowo Subianto and online transportation companies at the Presidential Palace. This decision is expected to benefit online drivers, but no specific financial metrics or details were disclosed.

title: Government Targets to Create 2.8-2.9 Million New Jobs Annually for the Next Five Years
body: The Indonesian government is optimistic about creating 2.8-2.9 million new jobs per year over the next five years, based on last year's labor absorption realization. This goal is expected to be achieved through investments and economic growth, with no specific company or industry mentioned.

title: Bank Central Asia to Hold Annual General Meeting of Shareholders, Dividend Distribution Decision Awaited
body: PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA) is set to kick off the annual general meeting of shareholders season on March 12, 2025, with one of the agendas being the determination of cash dividend distribution. Investors are closely monitoring banking stocks, particularly dividend hunters, as they await the decision on dividend payouts from banks.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls 0.57% to 6,598.21 on Monday Trading.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) fell 0.57% or 37.79 points to 6,598.21 on Monday, despite still being up 1.20% for the week, and down 6.8% since the start of the year.

title: Government to Launch Village Cooperative Program with Estimated Funding of IDR 210-350 Trillion
body: The Indonesian government plans to launch a program to establish 70,000 Red-White Village Cooperatives (Kopdes Merah Putih) on July 12, requiring funding of around IDR 210 trillion to IDR 350 trillion (approximately USD 14 billion to USD 24 billion). State-owned banks will be involved in financing this project, which is expected to be a significant burden on their balance sheets.

title: National Airlines in Indonesia Cut Ticket Prices and Offer Discounts for Domestic Flights During Lebaran 2025.
body: PT Garuda Indonesia Tbk (GIAA) predicts a 19% decrease in ticket prices for the 2025 Lebaran holiday period, with the discount policy also applying to its low-cost carrier, Citilink. This move is in line with the government's direction, as national airlines are cutting ticket prices or offering discounts for domestic flights during the holiday period.

title: Several Indonesian banks' sharia units grow, prompting regulators to push for spin-off into separate sharia banks.
body: CIMB Niaga Syariah (CIMB) and Bank Tabungan Negara (BTN) are set to spin off their Islamic banking units, with CIMB's assets reaching IDR 67.5 trillion, up 7.58% annually, and BTN's assets reaching IDR 60.56 trillion, up 11.55%. The spin-off is expected to be completed by Q1 2026 for CIMB and by the end of March 2025 for BTN, with the goal of creating standalone Islamic banks that can compete in the industry.

title: PT Jantra Grupo Indonesia Tbk Raises Rp 53.1 Billion in IPO on Indonesia Stock Exchange
body: PT Jantra Grupo Indonesia Tbk (KAQI) has officially listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange through an initial public offering, raising Rp 53.1 billion in fresh funds by issuing 450 million shares or 21.68% of its total placed and fully paid capital. The company, which operates in the automotive parts and accessories business, will use the funds to support its growth and expansion plans.

title: Vietnam's Communist Party Chief Calls for ASEAN to Become Global Production Hub
body: Vietnam's ruling Communist Party head, Lam, called for ASEAN to become a global production hub, highlighting the region's potential to produce goods and services on a global scale, with ASEAN's digital economy expected to top $1 trillion by 2030. ASEAN reported $234 billion in foreign direct investment inflows in 2023, up 2.1% from the previous year, with total trade goods amounting to $3.5 trillion, and overall exports totaling $1.8 billion over the same period.

title: Jakarta Composite Index Falls 0.79% as Goto and Other Stocks Weaken.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (JCI) fell 0.79% or 52.36 points to 6,545.85 on Tuesday, driven by declines in shares of PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO), PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk, and PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Tbk, which together contributed 22.96 points to the index's decline. Meanwhile, shares of PT DCI Indonesia Tbk, PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI), and PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI) helped to mitigate the decline, contributing 29.7 points to the index.

title: PT Sinergi Asia Corporindo sells 100 million shares of PT Sinergi Multi Lestariindo Tbk, earning IDR 8.5 billion.
body: PT Sinergi Asia Corporindo (SAC) divested 100 million shares of PT Sinergi Multi Lestariindo Tbk (SMLE) for IDR 8.5 billion, reducing its shareholding from 1.76 billion to 1.66 billion, or 4.3%. The transaction occurred after SMLE's shareholders approved the company's plan to expand into the pharmaceutical business, but SMLE's shares subsequently corrected 12.28% and closed down 2.91% in the following days.

title: Medela Potentia to Raise Up to IDR 805 Billion Through IPO of 3.5 Billion Shares on Indonesia Stock Exchange
body: PT Medela Potentia Tbk (MDLA) is set to raise up to IDR 805 billion through an initial public offering of 3.5 billion shares, equivalent to 25% of its issued and paid-up capital, at a price range of IDR 180-230 per share. After the IPO, MDLA plans to allocate 86.4% of the proceeds towards loans and capital contributions to AAM, 10% to DMM, and the remaining 3.6% to KITA.

title: Indosat's adoption of artificial intelligence technology leads to significant cost savings and improved network efficiency.
body: PT Indosat Tbk (ISAT) has utilized artificial intelligence (AI) technology to optimize its network operations, resulting in cost savings of IDR 3-4 trillion and improved capital expenditure efficiency, with the company spending only IDR 9-10 trillion out of its IDR 13 trillion capex budget. The implementation of AI has also enabled more proactive network management, improving operational efficiency and speeding up customer issue resolution, with ISAT allocating IDR 9.93 trillion to enhance its mobile network with AI-based digital technology.

title: Indonesia's Palm Oil Industry Holds Huge Potential for Sustainable Bioenergy Production
body: Indonesia's palm oil industry, which exported 32.21 million tons of crude palm oil and palm kernel oil worth $30.32 billion in 2023, has huge potential to produce biofuel from biomass wastes, potentially generating 29.52 million kiloliters of bioethanol and 4,336 MW of electrical energy. Optimally utilizing palm oil wastes could increase the industry's economic and environmental benefits, supporting Indonesia's energy self-sufficiency and resilience.

title: Prajogo Pangestu's Purchase of Barito Pacific Shares Fails to Boost Stock Price
body: Prajogo Pangestu, a conglomerate, has increased its stake in PT Barito Pacific Tbk (BRPT) twice in 2025, but the company's stock price has continued to decline. Despite the increased ownership, the stock has not seen a significant positive impact, with its year-to-date performance remaining negative.

title: Bank Pelat Merah Faces Potential Challenges in Financing Ambitious Red-White Village Cooperative Program
body: The Indonesian government's ambitious plan to establish a cooperative program, Koperasi Desa Merah Putih, aims to build economic centers in 70,000 villages, involving the construction of warehouses and six retail outlets in each village to store and sell agricultural products. However, the program's financing, which will be borne by Bank Pelat Merah, may face significant challenges that cannot be underestimated.

title: Foreign Investors' Selling Pressure Drags Down Indonesian Stock Market
body: Foreign investors' selling pressure has dragged down the composite stock price index since September 2024, with some LQ45 index member stocks experiencing a long-term downtrend. The market downturn has led to a decline in stock prices, with investors seeking to mitigate losses.

title: KPPU Completes Investigation into Alleged Cartel of Fintech Lending Companies Fixing Interest Rates
body: The Indonesian Competition Authority (KPPU) has completed its investigation into alleged cartel practices among fintech lending companies, suspecting that dozens of firms colluded to set interest rates, initially at 0.8% and later at 0.4% in 2021. The KPPU is now ready to proceed with legal proceedings, potentially leading to significant consequences for the companies involved.

title: Credit Insurance Claims Ratio Reaches 85.3% in 2024, Highest Among General Insurance Businesses
body: As of 2024, the claim ratio for credit insurance in Indonesia reached 85.3%, up from 75.6% in 2023, making it the line of business with the highest claim ratio for general insurance. This increase in claim ratio is a concern for the insurance industry, highlighting the need for improvement in this area.

title: Rupiah Weakens Against US Dollar Amid Uncertainty Over Tariff Policy and Widening Budget Deficit Projections.
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened against the US dollar on Tuesday, trading at Rp 16,409 per US dollar, a 0.26% decline from the previous day, due to uncertainty over tariff policies and a widening projected budget deficit. The rupiah also fell 0.63% to Rp 16,430 on the Jisdor Bank Indonesia index, highlighting the currency's continued struggles.

title: High Gold Prices and Increased Production to Offset Impact of Royalty Tariff Hike on PT Bumi Resources Minerals' Performance.
body: PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk (BUMI) is expected to maintain a positive performance outlook in 2025, driven by high gold prices and increased production, which can offset the impact of the planned royalty tariff hike. However, the tariff increase may affect the company's profit margin, as operational costs are likely to rise, eroding profitability, according to Kiwoom Sekuritas Indonesia analyst Miftahul Khaer.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Closes Weaker Due to US Market Concerns
body: The Indonesian composite stock price index (IHSG) closed 0.79% lower at 6,545.85 on Tuesday, influenced by the decline in the US stock market due to recession fears. According to Daniel Agustinus, Director of Kanaka Hita Solvera, the IHSG is expected to continue its downward trend.

title: Sharia Financing Sector Sees 9.96% Annual Growth in January 2025
body: As of January 2025, Sharia-based financing in Indonesia grew 9.96% year-over-year to IDR 27.92 trillion, driven by increases in investment and service financing. The Financial Services Authority predicts continued positive growth in Sharia-based financing, supported by factors such as diversification efforts and new product offerings from financing companies.

title: Rupiah Exchange Rate Remains Under Pressure Amid Challenges in Attracting Foreign Capital.
body: The Indonesian rupiah is expected to remain under pressure, potentially struggling to attract foreign capital inflows into the domestic financial market, despite the new export revenue-based foreign exchange policy. The rupiah spot rate closed at IDR 16,409 per US dollar on Tuesday, weakening 0.26% from the previous day and lower than the end of 2024's rate of around IDR 16,000 per dollar.

title: Consumer Confidence in Indonesia Decreases, a Warning for the Government to Maintain Purchasing Power.
body: According to a consumer survey by Bank Indonesia, consumer optimism decreased, with the Consumer Confidence Index in February 2025 dropping 1.2 points to 126.4, indicating a decline in purchasing power. This decline serves as a warning to the government to maintain consumer purchasing power to avoid adding to domestic economic instability.

title: Jakarta Stock Exchange Continues to Decline for Second Day Amid Negative Sentiment
body: The Indonesian stock market continued to decline on Tuesday, with the Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) falling 0.79% or 52,362 points to 6,545.85, marking the second consecutive day of decline. Foreign investors recorded a net sell of IDR 332.33 billion across all markets, amid a bearish sentiment that has been plaguing the bourse.

title: PGN to Accelerate Gas Infrastructure Development in Western Indonesia This Year
body: PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGN) plans to accelerate the development of gas infrastructure this year, focusing on building connectivity through pipeline distribution networks in western Indonesia to improve reliability and access for new customers. This move aims to enhance the company's services and expand its customer base.

title: Government Ensures Laid-Off Sritex Workers to Receive Job Loss Insurance and Other Benefits
body: The Indonesian government has ensured that employees of PT Sri Rejeki Isman Tbk (Sritex) who were laid off will receive certain guarantees, including old-age insurance and job loss insurance, with payments expected to be processed within two to three days. Additionally, the government is also working to provide holiday allowances to the affected workers, with the exact amount yet to be determined, following the layoffs of 11,025 employees across four companies in the Sritex group.

title: PLN Indonesia Power Prepares Electricity Supply for Ramadan with Capacity of Over 19.5 Gigawatt
body: PLN Indonesia Power (no ticker) has prepared a power supply of over 19.5 gigawatts to meet the increased electricity demand during Ramadan, with a net capacity of 19,504.5 megawatts from its power plants, ensuring a reliable and secure power supply throughout the holiday period.

title: Pertamina's Pelita Air Services Reduces Flight Ticket Prices by 15.8% for Lebaran 2025 Period.
body: Pelita Air Services, a subsidiary of PT Pertamina (PERTM), has reduced its ticket prices by 15.8% from March 24 to April 7, 2025, to support more affordable air travel during the Lebaran holiday period. Additionally, Pertamina has also adjusted its avtur prices by an average of 10% at 37 airport locations to further support affordable air travel.

title: Ministry of Agriculture Uncovers Two Cooking Oil Brands with Underfilled Packaging in Surprise Inspection
body: During a surprise inspection at Pasar Gede Hardjonagoro in Solo, Minister of Agriculture Andi Amran Sulaiman found two producers, PT Kusuma Mukti Remaja and PT Salim Ivomas Pratama, guilty of reducing the volume of oil in their packaging, with PT Kusuma Mukti Remaja's 1-liter product containing only 900 milliliters and PT Salim Ivomas Pratama's product lacking 50 milliliters from its stated volume. This incident highlights the issue of inaccurate product labeling and its potential impact on consumer trust and financial losses.

title: Government Issues Policies to Boost Economy During Lebaran Holiday Period
body: The Indonesian government has released policies to optimize the economy during the Lebaran holiday period, including a bonus policy for online drivers and a THR (Tunjangan Hari Raya) policy for private company employees, which must be given at least 7 days before Lebaran. This move is expected to boost the economy during the holiday period, with no specific financial metrics mentioned.

title: Foreign Investors' Acquisition of Indonesian Banks Slows Down
body: As of December 2024, foreign banks' market share in Indonesia's banking industry reached 24.96%, up from 24.70% in December 2023, according to data from the Financial Services Authority. Despite this growth, foreign investors' acquisition activities in the Indonesian banking sector have slowed down, and foreign-owned banks have yet to show optimal performance.

title: KPK Investigates Alleged Corruption Case at West Java Regional Development Bank Involving Former Governor Ridwan Kamil.
body: The Corruption Eradication Commission is investigating a corruption case at Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat (BJB), which has resulted in several suspects and a raid on the former governor of West Java's house, Ridwan Kamil, with the state suffering losses of hundreds of billions of rupiah. The case involves alleged corruption in advertising procurement at BJB, with the commission handling the investigation.

title: Government Prepares Presidential Regulation to Attract Investors to Waste-Based Power Plants
body: The Indonesian government is drafting a presidential regulation to attract investors to waste-to-energy power plants, which could increase electricity costs from these sources. The exact price per kilowatt-hour (kWh) has not been determined, but the government sees potential for growth in this area.

title: MPX Logistics International Targets 27.52% Revenue Growth to IDR 255.91 Billion in 2025
body: PT MPX Logistics International Tbk (MPXL) aims to boost revenue by 27.52% to IDR 255.91 billion in 2025, up from IDR 200.68 billion projected for 2024, driven by new revenue sources. The company's management expects this growth to increase its net profit throughout 2025.

title: Pertamina Prioritizes Geothermal Project Development with Danantara's Support for Renewable Energy Transition in Indonesia
body: Pertamina New Renewable Energy, a subsidiary of Grup Pertamina, is prioritizing geothermal projects that can be funded by Danantara, a state-owned investment management firm, to accelerate Indonesia's energy transition. Danantara, backed by at least seven state-owned enterprises including Grup Pertamina, plans to allocate capital and assets to invest in renewable energy projects in Indonesia.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Falls 0.79% to 6,545.85 at Close of Trading.
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) fell 0.79% or 52.36 points to 6,545.85 at the close of trading on the Indonesia Stock Exchange, despite still being up 2.59% over the past week. Since the start of the year, the IHSG has declined 7.54%.

title: Pemerintahan Baru Mulai Mengganti "Pemain" dengan Cara yang Mengkhawatirkan
body: The Indonesian government's 2025 budget plan has been revised, with significant cuts to several ministry budgets to allocate funds to new programs, and the appointment of new civil servants has been delayed from March to October 2025. This shift in policy is expected to lead to a major overhaul of officials, commissioners, and directors in state-owned enterprises and their subsidiaries, which could have a significant impact on the country's economy and governance.

title: Banks in Indonesia Prepare Large Amounts of Cash for Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr 2025 Amidst Increasing Digital Transactions
body: PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA) has prepared IDR 70.22 trillion in cash for the Ramadan and Lebaran period in 2025, an increase from the previous year, while PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (BNI) has allocated IDR 21 trillion, a decrease from IDR 26.6 trillion in 2024. Meanwhile, Bank Indonesia has prepared IDR 180.9 trillion for the exchange of new currency during the Idul Fitri holiday, a 1.6% decrease from IDR 183.8 trillion in 2024.

title: Vinfast plans to build electric vehicle factory in Indonesia following meeting with President Prabowo Subianto.
body: Vinfast, a Vietnamese electric vehicle manufacturer, plans to build a factory in Indonesia, as discussed in a meeting between CEO Pham Sanh Chau and President Prabowo Subianto at the Presidential Palace in Jakarta. This investment is part of Vinfast's (VFS) aggressive expansion in Indonesia, further solidifying the country's position as a hub for electric vehicle production.

title: Banks Struggle to Benefit from 100% Domestic Placement of Export Earnings Due to Competition from BI Instruments.
body: The regulation requiring 100% of export earnings from natural resources to be placed in domestic banks was expected to bring a flood of foreign exchange liquidity to the banking sector, but banks are still struggling to reap the benefits. This is because banks must compete with Bank Indonesia's instruments, such as foreign exchange securities and sukuk, which can also be used to place export earnings.

title: PT Sinar Terang Mandiri Tbk Lists Shares on Indonesia Stock Exchange, Raises IDR 1.103 Trillion
body: PT Sinar Terang Mandiri Tbk (MINE) listed its shares on the Indonesia Stock Exchange through an initial public offering, raising funds that will be used to develop nickel mining operations, with a market capitalization of IDR 1.103 trillion. The company reported a 40.8% year-on-year revenue growth to IDR 1.36 trillion and a 278.3% increase in net profit to IDR 165.65 billion as of August 31, 2024.

title: TBS Energi Utama sells 90 percent of coal mining subsidiary shares to KSA.
body: PT TBS Energi Utama Tbk (TBS) has completed the sale of 90% of its coal mining business subsidiary shares, with a transaction value of IDR 3.39 billion, and the company's shares rose 1.14% to IDR 354 on the Indonesia Stock Exchange. The divestment is not expected to negatively impact TBS's operations, legal status, financial condition, or business continuity, and the company's shares have corrected 23.71% over the past three months.

title: PT Golden Energy Mines Tbk reports 10% increase in coal production to 50.7 million tons in 2024.
body: PT Golden Energy Mines Tbk (GEMS) achieved a coal production of 50.7 million tons in 2024, a 10% increase from 2023, with coal sales reaching 51.9 million tons, an 11% increase from the previous year. The company reported a net profit of USD 473.8 million, an 8.6% decline from 2023, primarily due to a 6.77% decrease in operating revenue, which stood at USD 2.7 billion.

title: PT Kreasi Jasa Persada increases stake in PT Petrosea TBK through IDR 120.37 billion share purchase.
body: PT Kreasi Jasa Persada has increased its stake in PT Petrosea TBK (PTRO) by purchasing 39.7 million shares at IDR 3,030.66 per share, totaling IDR 120.37 billion, which will increase its voting rights to 41.91%. PTRO secured a mining services contract worth IDR 4.03 trillion and reported a 19.59% year-over-year revenue increase to USD 690.81 million in 2024, despite a 20.74% decline in net profit to USD 9.69 million.

title: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi TBK Achieves Record-High Revenue and Profit in 2024 with Diversification and Sustainable Expansion
body: PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk (PTPJ) reported a record-breaking 2024 performance, with total revenue reaching USD 801.7 million, a 719% increase from the previous year, and net profit attributable to owners of the parent entity surging 929% to USD 160.8 million. The company's revenue diversification efforts paid off, with coal sales decreasing to 34% of total revenue, and the company achieving its first-ever positive retained earnings of USD 124.1 million, enabling dividend distribution to shareholders.

title: ABM Investama Explores Gold Mine Acquisition Opportunities with Minority Stake Strategy
body: PT ABM Investama Tbk (ABMM) is exploring opportunities to diversify by acquiring a gold mine, with plans to enter the sector as a minority shareholder with a 25%-30% ownership stake, aiming to have a diversified EBITDA composition by 2030. The company has recently announced plans to acquire shares of PT Piranti Jaya Utama for USD 57 million, equivalent to IDR 939.36 billion, through its subsidiary PT Reswara Minergi Hartama.

title: Indonesia's Mining Industry Reshuffles Board of Commissioners and Directors
body: PT Mineral Industri Indonesia (MIND ID) has reshuffled its board of commissioners and directors, with new appointments including Agung Setya Imam Effendi, Nugroho Widyotomo, and Tri Winarno, and Maroef Sjamsoeddin as the new President Director, replacing Hendi Prio Santoso. The changes aim to strengthen the company's leadership and direction, with no specific financial metrics or outcomes mentioned in the article.

title: Regional Council of North Halmahera Regency Holds Meeting with PT Nusa Halmahera Mineral to Address Operational Issues
body: PT Nusa Halmahera Mineral (NHM) is taking steps to address issues affecting its production, including allocating 25% of production results to employee salaries, after experiencing decreased results during the COVID-19 pandemic. The company has managed to cut employee wages by IDR 85 billion in the first phase of efficiency and is planning to adjust wages according to production volume in the second phase, with a potential partnership with a Chinese company to conduct mining at its location.

title: Bank Indonesia predicts retail sales to decline in February 2025 due to contraction in household goods and food sales.
body: Bank Indonesia predicts a 0.5% year-over-year contraction in retail sales in February 2025, driven by a 5.3% decline in household goods sales and a 1.7% drop in food, beverage, and tobacco sales. This marks a reversal from the 0.5% year-over-year growth in retail sales in the previous month, according to the central bank's survey.

title: Fitch Ratings Maintains Indonesia's Investment Grade Credit Rating Amid Predicted Economic Slowdown
body: Fitch Ratings maintains Indonesia's debt rating at BBB with a stable outlook, indicating the country remains at investment grade, but predicts the economy will face challenges, including a potential slowdown to 5% growth in 2025 and 4.9% in 2026. This growth forecast is lower than the government's target of 5.2% in 2025 and 5.3% in 2026, as outlined in the national medium-term development plan.

title: Indonesia's 2025 State Budget Tax Revenue Realization Drops 41.86% in January.
body: Indonesia's Ministry of Finance collected only IDR 88.89 trillion in tax revenue in January, a 41.86% decline from the same period last year, which saw IDR 152.89 trillion in revenue. This significant drop in tax revenue is a concerning start to the 2025 state budget, with a shortfall of IDR 64 trillion compared to the previous year.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Index Rises 1.82% to 6,665.04 on Wednesday
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) surged 1.82% to 6,665.04 on Wednesday, driven by sentiment around dividend distributions. Technically, the IHSG formed a White Marubozu indicator, closing above the MA20, indicating a bullish trend.

title: DPR Quietly Revises Financial Sector Development Law Following Constitutional Court Ruling
body: The Indonesian House of Representatives is revising the Financial Sector Development and Strengthening Act No. 4/2023, following a Constitutional Court ruling that declared the Deposit Insurance Agency's (LPS) governing structure unconstitutional. The revision will remove the LPS's budget from the Finance Minister's approval, elevating its position to be on par with Bank Indonesia and the Financial Services Authority.

title: Indonesian Stock Market Rises 1.82% with Foreign Investors Recording Net Buy of IDR 148.74 Billion
body: The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) surged 1.82% to 6,665.04 at the close of Wednesday's trading, with foreign investors recording a net buy of around IDR 148.74 billion. Analysts provided several stock recommendations amidst this rebound, which Kontan has compiled for investors.

title: Depo Bangunan Expects Increased Sales of Building Materials During Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr
body: PT Caturkarda Depo Bangunan Tbk (DEPO) expects a positive growth in sales of building materials during the Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr period, driven by increased consumer purchasing power due to holiday bonuses. The company is optimistic about the peak season, anticipating an additional revenue boost from the momentum of the holy month and subsequent celebrations.

title: Goto reports 94.29% decrease in losses in 2024 driven by increased revenue and other income.
body: PT Goto Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) reported a 94.29% decrease in losses in 2024 compared to 2023, driven by a 7.50% year-on-year increase in revenue to IDR 15.89 trillion, led by growth in e-commerce service fees, lending, delivery services, and advertising fees. Despite a decline in service fees, the company's operating loss decreased by 78.20% to IDR 2.4 trillion, and pre-tax losses reduced to IDR 5.27 trillion, resulting in a net loss of IDR 5.15 trillion.

title: Elang Mahkota Teknologi to Issue 300 Million Shares for Employee Stock Ownership Program
body: PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk (EMTK) plans to issue 300 million shares through a management employee stock ownership program for its commissioners, directors, and employees, which will be implemented within the next five years after shareholder approval. The program will result in a slight change in EMTK's shareholder structure, with the public stake decreasing to 28.58% and the MESOP program holding 0.49% of the company's shares.

title: Matahari Department Store Proposes 50% Increase in Cash Dividend to IDR 300 per Share at Upcoming AGM.
body: PT Matahari Department Store Tbk (LPPF) has proposed a cash dividend of IDR 300 per share, a 50% increase from IDR 200 per share in 2023, following a strong performance with a 22.5% increase in net profit to IDR 827.65 billion in 2024. The total dividend allocation is estimated to reach IDR 677.8 billion, approximately 80% of 2024 net profit, with an indicative dividend yield of 15.96% at the current stock price of IDR 1,880 per share.

title: PT Asuransi Multi Artha Guna Records 54.37% Increase in Net Profit in 2024
body: PT Asuransi Multi Artha Guna Tbk (AMAG) reported a 54.37% increase in net profit to IDR 228.59 billion in 2024, driven by a rise in net premium income, with total revenue reaching IDR 1.03 trillion, up 11.72% year-on-year. The company's pre-tax profit also surged 56.95% to IDR 247.65 billion, leading to a 4.22% increase in its share price to IDR 346 per share, with a 15.33% growth over the past year.

title: PT Rukun Raharja to Retain 70% Ownership of PT Raharja Energi Cepu after 10% Share Divestment
body: PT Rukun Raharja Tbk (RAJA) will retain around 70% ownership of PT Raharja Energi Cepu Tbk (RATU) after completing a planned 10% share divestment, with the first phase already sold at 4.66% or 126.52 million shares, reducing RAJA's stake to 75.34%. The divestment has led to a decline in RATU's share price by 15.66% or IDR 975 over the past week, while RAJA's shares have also dropped by 15.87% or IDR 430.

title: Indonesia's new sovereign wealth fund Danantara to prioritize food and renewable energy investments, but must address deforestation concerns.
body: Danantara, Indonesia's new sovereign wealth fund with $900 billion in assets, is prioritizing investments in food and renewable energy, including palm oil development, which requires significant land resources and may encounter deforestation issues. To address these concerns, the government must redefine forest areas, introduce new concepts like "legal or justified deforestation," and conduct thorough assessments to ensure sustainable development and environmental viability.

title: Global investment firms accumulate shares of PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya amid declining stock price.
body: Thirteen global investment firms have accumulated shares of PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Tbk (AMRT), the owner of Alfamart retail network, despite its stock price dropping 20.53% in the last month. According to Bloomberg data, these investors have been buying AMRT shares from March 1 to 12, 2025, while only three investors have sold their stakes.

title: Pelita Air Prepares Additional 5,040 Seats for 2025 Lebaran Mudik Season
body: Pelita Air (no ticker) has prepared additional flights with a capacity of 5,040 seats, increasing its total seat capacity to 293,688 seats, ahead of the 2025 Lebaran mudik season. The airline is also planning to increase flight frequencies and potentially add extra flights on routes such as Medan, Padang, Pekanbaru, and Denpasar to enhance passenger comfort and safety.

title: Indonesia's Franchise Industry Remains Promising with 311 Operating Franchises and 97,872 Local Jobs.
body: As of February, there are 311 franchises operating in Indonesia, comprising 157 domestic and 154 foreign franchises, which have absorbed 97,872 local workers and generated a total revenue of IDR 143.25 trillion. The food and beverage sector dominates the franchise industry, accounting for 47% of the market, followed by beauty, education, non-formal, retail, and other sectors.

title: Automotive companies prepare to boost car sales during Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr period.
body: Honda Prospect Motor expects a 10%-20% increase in car sales during the Ramadan and Idul Fitri period, driven by demand for entry-level models like Honda Brio and sport utility vehicles. This momentum is expected to boost car sales in March 2025, with the company historically experiencing a surge in sales during this period.

title: Government Considers Increasing Toll Discounts to Ease Traffic Congestion During Lebaran Holiday
body: The Indonesian Ministry of Public Works is considering increasing the toll road discount from 20% to a higher percentage during the Lebaran holiday period to reduce traffic congestion, following the lead of companies like Jasa Marga (JSMR) and Hutama Karya, which have already offered 20% discounts on certain toll roads. Meanwhile, Raharja Energi Cepu reported a profit of US$13.87 million at the end of 2024, a 42.92% decrease.

title: Government Collaborates with Law Enforcement to Ensure Proper Use of Village Funds
body: The Indonesian government has allocated IDR 610 trillion in village funds over the past 10 years, with IDR 71 trillion budgeted for this year. The Ministry of Villages and Development of Disadvantaged Regions is working with law enforcement agencies to ensure the secure use of these funds.

title: Pertamina Hulu Energi Targets 416,000 Barrels of Oil and 2.536 Million Standard Cubic Feet of Gas Production per Day by 2025.
body: PT Pertamina Hulu Eneri (PHE) targets to increase its oil production to 416,000 barrels per day by 2025, a 4% increase from its 2024 realization of 400,000 barrels per day. Additionally, PHE aims to produce 2.536 million standard cubic feet of gas per day in 2025, a 3% increase from its 2024 realization of 2.454 million standard cubic feet per day.

title: PT Mulia Boga Raya TBK Remains Optimistic About Maintaining Positive Performance This Year
body: PT Mulia Boga Raya Tbk (MULI) remains optimistic about maintaining its positive performance this year, driven by growing demand for cheese products and increasing consumption of healthy food, particularly among the growing middle class. The company's management believes it can build on last year's achievements, with factors such as population growth and rising health awareness contributing to its positive outlook.

title: PGN Prepares Strategic Programs and Investments to Strengthen Gas Infrastructure and Expand Services in Indonesia
body: PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGAS) is preparing strategic programs and investments to strengthen gas infrastructure connectivity, increase the use of green energy, and expand gas services in Indonesia, focusing on customer attachment to attract new industrial and commercial customers in Java and Sumatra. The company will also enhance pipeline infrastructure connectivity, including the Tegal-Cilacap pipeline project, to supply gas from East Java to Cilacap, meeting industrial needs, including those of refineries in the area.

title: Government Plans to Build Multiple Oil Refineries with Total Capacity of 1 Million Barrels per Day Across Indonesia
body: The Indonesian government plans to build oil refineries with a total capacity of 1 million barrels per day across several locations in the country, revising its previous plan to build a single refinery with a capacity of 500,000 barrels per day in Pulau Pemping, Riau Islands. The refineries will be scattered across various regions, including Sumatra, Kalimantan, and possibly East Indonesia, according to Deputy Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Yuliot Tanjung.

title: Fintech Lending Industry Faces Rising Credit Risk with 22 Companies Experiencing High Default Rates
body: As of December 2024, 22 fintech lending companies in Indonesia have a high risk of default, with a 90-day past due (TWP90) rate above 5%, according to the Financial Services Authority. This number has increased by one company compared to November 2024, highlighting the need for serious attention to the health of fintech lending portfolios amidst the threat of rising bad loans.

title: Government to Develop 77 Strategic National Projects, Including Giant Sea Wall, with Private Sector Investment
body: The Indonesian government has listed 77 strategic national projects, including the Giant Sea Wall project, which is expected to require significant investment, with estimated costs not disclosed, and is seeking private sector partnerships to fund the project. The project is expected to generate land value capture, with potential investments in toll roads, solar power plants, and hydroelectric power plants, including a 9,000-megawatt project by PT Kayan Hydro Energy (no ticker symbol).

title: Survey shows 62.3 percent of respondents trust transparency of Indonesia's new sovereign wealth fund Danantara.
body: A recent survey shows that 62.3% of respondents trust the transparency of Indonesia's newly launched sovereign wealth fund, Danantara, which is expected to have assets under management of $900 billion and initial capital of $20 billion for high-impact projects. Danantara will consolidate assets from seven state-run enterprises, including Mandiri (BMRI), BRI (BBRI), BNI (BNI), PLN (PLN), Pertamina (PERTM), Mind ID (MIND), and Telkom (TLKM), with the goal of investing in projects with good governance and transparency.

title: Goto's stock price surges 3.75% to IDR 83 per share following the release of its 2024 financial report.
body: PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) shares surged 3.75% to IDR 83 per share on Wednesday, driven by the release of its improved 2024 financial report, which offset the negative impact of the company's plan to give bonuses to online drivers and couriers. Prior to this, GOTO's share price had fallen, dropping 1.16% to IDR 85 on Monday and 5.88% to IDR 80 on Tuesday.

title: Domestic Bond Market Prospects Remain Attractive Despite Rising US Treasury Yield.
body: The domestic bond market prospect remains attractive despite the 10-year US Treasury yield rising to 4.25%, as the yield has been suppressed over the past month. The 10-year US Treasury yield currently stands at 4.28%, up from 4.22% the previous week, but the overall trend remains subdued.

title: Rupiah Exchange Rate Drops Against US Dollar on Wednesday Trading.
body: The Indonesian rupiah weakened against the US dollar on Wednesday, falling 0.13% to Rp 16,452 per dollar, according to Bloomberg, and 0.14% to Rp 16,453 at Bank Indonesia.

title: Indonesian Mining Sector Faces Challenges Amidst Commodity Price Pressure and Government Policies.
body: Indonesia's mining sector is facing a gloomy outlook due to commodity price pressure and a series of government policies that add to the burden of issuers. The sector's struggles are expected to continue, posing challenges for companies operating in the industry.

title: Indonesian Sukuk Tabungan ST014 Sees Positive Response with Rp 5.19 Trillion in Sales.
body: The Indonesian market responded positively to the sale of Sukuk Tabungan Seri ST014, which began trading last week, with sales reaching Rp 5.19 trillion as of Wednesday, 20:54 WIB. The two-year tenor has been sold 38% or equivalent to Rp 4.18 trillion out of the quota of Rp 11 trillion.

title: Bank Central Asia Announces Leadership Reshuffle and Dividend Allocation Following Annual General Meeting
body: Bank Central Asia (BCA) announced a leadership reshuffle, with Jahja Setiaatmadja stepping down as President Director to become President Commissioner, and Gregory Hendra Lembong taking over as President Director, ensuring continuity in the bank's strategic direction. The bank reported a net profit of Rp 54.8 trillion in the 2024 fiscal year and approved a cash dividend of Rp 300.00 per share, an 11.1% increase from the previous year.

title: Bank Syariah Indonesia's 2025 Performance Prospects Remain Positive Despite Current Stock Pressure
body: PT Bank Syariah Indonesia Tbk (BRIS) is expected to maintain a positive performance in 2025 despite its stock experiencing high pressure, according to Investment Analyst Edvisor Profina Visindo Ahmad Iqbal Suyudi. The bank's prospects remain attractive amidst tight banking liquidity, with potential for growth in the future.

title: Multifinance Industry Pins Hopes on Used Car Credit Segment Amidst Stagnant New Car Market.
body: PT Cimb Niaga Auto Finance (CIMB) predicts a positive growth trend in used car financing during Ramadan, driven by increased demand for vehicles ahead of the holiday season. The company expects a surge in financing for used cars, a key segment for the multifinance industry, as people prepare for mudik (annual homecoming) during Lebaran.

title: PT Sinergi Asia Corporindo Sells 100 Million Shares of PT Sinergi Multi Lestariindo Tbk for IDR 8.5 Billion
body: PT Sinergi Asia Corporindo sold 100 million shares of PT Sinergi Multi Lestariindo Tbk (SMLE) at IDR 85 per share, generating IDR 8.5 billion in divestment proceeds. The transaction, which took place on March 5, 2025, was aimed at divestment, with PT Sinergi Asia Corporindo directly holding the shares.

title: PT Raharja Energi Cepu's Net Income Rises 22.74% to $57.74 Million in 2024
body: PT Raharja Energi Cepu Tbk (RECP) reported a net income of $57.74 million in 2024, a 22.74% year-over-year increase from $47.04 million in 2023, driven by revenue from third-party oil and gas lifting activities. The company, a subsidiary of PT Rukun Raharja Tbk, saw all of its net income in 2024 come from these activities.

title: President Prabowo Subianto Announces Early Payment of Civil Servants' Bonuses and 13th Month Salary Before Eid al-Fitr
body: President Prabowo Subianto announced that the 13th salary and holiday allowance for civil servants will be paid two weeks before Eid al-Fitr, starting Monday, which is expected to boost people's purchasing power. Meanwhile, the Minister of Manpower, Yassierli, stated that the THR (Holiday Allowance) must be paid at least 7 days before the religious holiday, further supporting the increase in consumer spending.

title: Medela Potentia to Raise Rp 805 Billion in IPO, Listing on Indonesia Stock Exchange
body: Medela Potentia (MDLA) is preparing for an initial public offering to raise Rp 805 billion in fresh capital by offering 25% of its total equity, or 3.5 billion shares, at a price range of Rp 180-230 per share. The company, which reported net revenue of Rp 10.78 trillion and net profit of Rp 252.74 billion in September 2024, plans to allocate 86.4% of the IPO proceeds to its subsidiary Anugrah Argon Medica for loan repayment and additional capital injection.

title: Indonesian Government Reaffirms Eid Bonus Obligation for Private Sector Employers, Extends Relief to Gig Workers
body: The Indonesian government has reaffirmed the obligation of private sector employers to provide Eid bonuses, known as Tunjangan Hari Raya, to full-time employees, with a significant policy shift extending financial relief to gig workers, including online drivers and couriers of ride-hailing and delivery companies. Employers must pay the bonus, equivalent to one month's salary for employees with over a year of service, no later than seven days before Eid al-Fitr, with non-compliant companies facing legal and administrative penalties, including fines and work restrictions.

title: Indonesians' confidence in country's economic conditions dips slightly but remains optimistic.
body: Indonesia's consumer confidence index (CCI) fell to 126.4 in February from 127.2 in January, indicating a slight decline in optimism, with those spending between IDR 2.1 million and IDR 3 million per month showing the largest decrease in confidence. Despite this, the current economic confidence index (CECI) rose to 114.2, driven by improving wage sentiment, and the consumer expectation index remained optimistic at 138.7, with Indonesians spending more on goods and services, saving 14.7% of their income, and allocating 10.6% to debt payments.
